title: Adriana Lima Is Selling Her Fortress-Adjacent LA Home That's Complete with AI Cameras and Laser Beams for $15.995 Million
description: Adriana Lima and Andrew Lemmers III are saying goodbye to Los Angeles and heading to New York, according to The Wall Street Journal. The Brazilian supermodel and the film producer have listed their Brentwood property for $15.995 million. According to ...
content:
Benzinga and Yahoo Finance LLC may earn commission or revenue on some items through the links below.

Adriana Lima and Andrew Lemmers III are saying goodbye to Los Angeles and heading to New York, according to The Wall Street Journal. The Brazilian supermodel and the film producer have listed their Brentwood property for $15.995 million.

According to Zillow, the 0.34-acre home was built in 2022, which is when the famous couple purchased it for $12.35 million. So, why are Lima and Lemmers bidding it adieu after just three years? In an email to the Journal, they said they've been spending more time "on the other side of the country" and in Europe, prompting the move to New York.
• Would you have invested in eBay or Uber early? The same backers are betting on this vacation home platform at just $2.90 per share.
• Kevin O'Leary Says Real Estate's Been a Smart Bet for 200 Years — This Platform Lets Anyone Tap Into It

"Tucked behind custom gates and mature hedging on one of the widest lots in the flats of North Bundy – with 120 feet of frontage – this modern Brentwood estate delivers an extraordinary blend of privacy, design, and innovation," says the Compass listing held by Paul Salazar.

The custom gates aren't the only line of defense — far from it, actually. You won't find this level of security in just any house. There's an AI-powered camera system, laser beams, automated perimeter alerts after hours and a 24/7 armed patrol service all in place.

Besides the impressive security, this property has just about everything a family could need. The main home features five bedrooms and seven bathrooms, along with a room that could be used as an additional bedroom, office or den. There's a detached guest house that has its own bedroom and bathroom, too.

Trending: 7 Million Gamers Already Trust Gameflip With Their Digital Assets — Now You Can Own a Stake in the Platform

The main kitchen has two islands and Miele appliances, including a refrigerator, two dishwashers, an oven, a microwave and an espresso station. There's a tucked-away chef's kitchen with a Miele refrigerator and freezer, an eight-burner Wolf range and a walk-in pantry. Finish it off with a climate-controlled wine rack, and this home was made to entertain. The downstairs also features various entertainment areas, including a living room, sitting room and dining room. To encourage indoor-outdoor living, the first floor kitchen and living room open up to the in-ground pool and hot tub, outdoor kitchen and fire pit.
summary: Adriana Lima and Andrew Lemmers III are selling their Brentwood property for $15.995 million, complete with AI Cameras and Laser Beams. The 0.34-acre home was built in 2022 and purchased for $12.35 million three years ago. Lima and Lemmers have been moving to New York due to increased spending time in Europe and spending more time there. The property also features a 24/7 armed patrol service and five bedrooms and seven bathrooms. The main kitchen features Miele appliances, a chef's kitchen, an eight-burner Wolf range, and a climate-controlled wine rack.
shortSummary: Adriana Lima and Andrew Lemmers are selling their Brentwood home for $15.995 million, featuring AI-powered camera systems and extensive interior design.

argos_summary: Brazilian supermodel Adriana Lima and film producer Andrew Lemmers III are selling their 0.34‑acre Brentwood estate for $15.995 million after buying it in 2022 for $12.35 million. The modern home, built in 2022, boasts five bedrooms, seven bathrooms, a detached guest house, an in‑ground pool, and high‑tech security including AI cameras and 24/7 patrols. The couple cited increased time spent in New York and Europe as the reason for the sale. The listing, managed by Compass, highlights the property’s privacy, design, and entertainment amenities. The article also references unrelated investment and real‑estate commentary, but focuses on the Lima‑Lemmers sale.
